intro: Minuartia nuristanica, commonly known as the Nuristan sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and fleshy. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh alpine conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
